document.heading: Traffic Adjudication and Motor Carrier Safety Amendment Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-173, the “Traffic Adjudication and Motor Carrier Safety Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-501, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 23, 1992, and July 7, 1992, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 23, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-271 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-173 became effective on October 1, 1992.
